contentrichtext.text: {{About|the alternative rock band Adam Again|the 1976 CCM album by Michael Omartian entitled ''Adam Again''|Adam Again (album)}} {{Infobox musical artist <!-- See Wikipedia:WikiProject_Musicians --> | name = Adam Again | image = Adam Again.jpg | caption = L–R: Gene Eugene, Paul Valadez, Greg Lawless, Jon Knox, Riki Michele | image_size = 300 | background = group_or_band | alias = | origin = [[Huntington Beach, California|Huntington Beach]], [[California]], U.S. | instrument = | genre = [[Alternative rock]]<br />[[Funk rock]] | occupation = | years_active = 1982–2000 | label = [[Blue Collar Records]]<br />Brainstorm Artists International<br />[[Galaxy21 Music]]<br />[[Lo-Fidelity Records]]<br />[[KMG Records]] | associated_acts = | website = | current_members = [[Gene Eugene]]<br />[[Riki Michele]]<br />Greg Lawless<br />Paul Valadez<br />[[Jon Knox]] | past_members = [[Dan Michaels]] | notable_instruments = }} '''Adam Again''' was a [[rock music|rock]] band founded and led by [[vocalist]] [[Gene Eugene]], with [[Riki Michele]] on vocals, Paul Valadez on [[Bass guitar|bass]], [[Jon Knox]] on [[Drum kit|drums]], Greg Lawless on guitar. [[Dan Michaels]] often played [[saxophone]]. Thom Jurek of [[allmusic]] has described as "inventive and artfully canny."<ref>{{cite web |url={{Allmusic|class=album|id=r398413|pure_url=yes}} |title=allmusic ((( ''Worldwide Favorites'' > Overview ))) |accessdate=2009-02-23 |author=Thom Jurek |publisher=[[allmusic]]}}</ref>The band never achieved commercial viability and quit touring and recording together in 2000 after Eugene died in his recording studio, the "fabulous" [[The Green Room (recording studio)|Green Room]]. ==Discography== *''[[In a New World of Time]]'' (1986) Release only on vinyl and cassette by Blue Collar Records *''[[Ten Songs by Adam Again]]'' (1988) *''[[Homeboys (Adam Again album)|Homeboys]]'' (1990) *''[[Dig (Adam Again album)|Dig]]'' (1992) *''[[Perfecta (album)|Perfecta]]'' (1995) *''[[Worldwide Favourites]]'' (1999, Reviews: ''[http://web.archive.org/web/20010714054509/www.hmmagazine.com/issue76/76Albums.htm HM Magazine]'',<ref name="HM_76">{{cite journal |last=Van Pelt |first=Doug |year=1999 |month=March/April |title=Album Reviews: Adam Again ''worldwide favourites'' |journal=[[HM Magazine]] |issue=76 |pages= |accessdate=2007-04-24 |issn=1066-6923}}</ref> ''[http://www.tollbooth.org/review99/adamagain.html The Phantom Tollbooth]'') **Best-of collection with a previously unreleased track entitled "Sleepwalk." *''[[A Tribute to Gene Eugene]]'' (2000, Review: ''[http://www.tollbooth.org/2001/reviews/aagain2.html The Phantom Tollbooth]'') **Live concert recording with various vocalists. *''[[Adam Again Tribute Boxed Set]]'' (2001) ==Reissues== *''[[In a New World of Time]]'' (1990) Reissue on CD by An Adam Again Independent Recording AAIR0001 *''[[Homeboys (Adam Again album)|Homeboys]] + [[Dig (Adam Again album)|Dig]]'' (Music Value Pack) (2000) This KMG Records contains 2 albums on 1 cd. It is missing "No Regret" from ''Homeboys'', and "So Long" from ''Dig''. *''[[Ten Songs by Adam Again]]'' (2002) Remastered by Lo-Fidelity Records. Only 1000 copies were made. *''[[Ten Songs by Adam Again]]'' (2012) Remastered by Frontline Records.
